recipe_name: Scones with apple sauce and clotted cream
author: Lesley Waters
method: Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. For the scones, place the flour, sugar and baking powder into a food processor and pulse to combine. With the motor running, pour in the milk and melted butter, adding more milk if necessary to bring together into a ball of dough.  Turn the dough out onto a floured work surface and shape into a ball. Flatten the ball slightly, and cut into wedges. Heat the remaining butter in an ovenproof frying pan, add the scone wedges and fry for 1-2 minutes on each side, or until starting to colour. Transfer to the oven to cook for 6-8 minutes, or until risen and golden-brown. For the sauce, place all of the jam ingredients into a pan and cook 6-7 minutes, or until the apples are very tender. Mash with a fork.  Serve the scones on a board alongside a dish of the apple sauce and clotted cream.
ingredients: 150g/5½ oz self-raising flour, plus extra for dusting,  2 tbsp caster sugar,  ½ tsp baking powder,  2 tbsp milk, or enough to bind,  2 tbsp butter, melted,  25g/1oz butter,  1 dessert apple, cored and sliced,  25g/1oz butter,  2 tbsp brown sugar,  ½ tsp cinnamon,  1 lemon, zest and juice only,  clotted cream
